sentences.en: Chew each mouthful fully before the next bite.
sentences.cn: 将每一口充分咀嚼后，再吃下一口。

sentences.en: He ate his meal slowly, savouring every mouthful.
sentences.cn: 他细嚼慢咽地吃着饭，一口一口地品味。

sentences.en: He bolted down a few mouthful of food and hurried back to the workshop.
sentences.cn: 他匆匆忙忙吃了几口东西,又回车间去了.

sentences.en: He scooped up some water with his hands and took a big mouthful.
sentences.cn: 他捧起水来喝了一大口.

sentences.en: He took a mouthful of the cheap wine and sloshed it around his mouth.
sentences.cn: 他喝了一口廉价的葡萄酒，在嘴巴里来回咂摸着。

sentences.en: He wants to eat it up at a mouthful.
It's called the Pan-Carib-bean Disaster Preparedness and Prevention Project, which is quite a mouthful.
sentences.cn: 它被称为thePan-CaribbeanDisasterPreparednessandPreventionProject（泛加勒比备灾防灾项目），名称相当冗长拗口。

sentences.en: Michael told his story between mouthfuls.
sentences.cn: 迈克尔边吃边讲他的故事。

sentences.en: Savour the flavour of each mouthful, and chew your food well.
sentences.cn: 细细品尝每一口的味道，充分咀嚼。

sentences.en: She gulped down a mouthful of coffee.
She spoke through a mouthful of chicken.
sentences.cn: 她说话时嘴里含着一块鸡肉.

sentences.en: She swallowed a mouthful of the hot strong brew, and wiped her eyes.
sentences.cn: 她喝了一口热浓茶，又擦了擦眼睛。

sentences.en: She took a mouthful of food and then suddenly spat it out.
sentences.cn: 她吃了一口食物，突然又吐了出来。

sentences.en: She took a mouthful of water.
When dog bites dog, each gets a mouthful of fur -- usually indicating unjustifiable disputes .
sentences.cn: 狗咬狗, 两嘴 毛.

phrases.tran_cn: (英，非正式)怒斥，对某人大喊大叫
(北美，非正式)说到点子上；说出值得注意的话

trans.tran_cn: 一口，满口，<俚>适当[不适当]的批评[暗示]
trans.tran_en: an amount of food or drink that you put into your mouth at one time
